casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Joel GOUIN, a.k.a. J, Defendant-Appellant. No. 06-10962

Non-Argument Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Eleventh Circuit. Sept. 27, 2006. Joel Gouin, Coleman, FL, pro se. Linda Julin McNamara, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Tampa, FL, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Before DUBINA, CARNES and HULL, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:

Thomas H. Ostrander, court-appointed counsel for Joel Gouin in this direct criminal appeal, has moved to withdraw from further representation of the appellant and filed a brief pursuant to Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Our independent review of the entire record reveals that counsel’s assessment of the relative merit of the appeal is correct. Because independent examination of the entire record reveals no arguable issues of merit, counsel’s motion to withdraw is GRANTED and Gouin’s convictions and sentences are AFFIRMED.
